Description: Plain hemispherical bowl in copper alloy, shaped by hammering.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Illustrated in drawing in Petrie, Naukratis 1, pl. 12. For the type (normally found in tombs on Cyprus) cf. Matthaeus 1985, 100 note 65, pl. 7.155; Chavane 1990, 1 note 14, pl. 24, 25.

Petrie mentioned this bowl in his journal (Journal 1884-85, p. 161): "A splendid bronze bowl was brought to me today by a man who had had it for a year or two lying in his house; it is 6 in[che]s across & 2 ½ high, perfectly plain portion of a sphere outside & the same inside except a thicker rim flat on the top. This plainness looks to me very early, & it will be a treasure if we can only get it to England. I gave 3/s for it."
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (RB.01)
